module.p: barrachd more, predominance, preponderance is an indeclinable feminine generic quantity noun expressing a larger comparative quantity.

section.p:
On its own –
Dh’òl Raonaid barrachd. Rachel drank more.
Tha barrachd aig Màiri. Mary has more.
Tha fhios againn bho Einstein gu feum sinn sin a dhèanamh agus ’se sin as coireach gu bheil barrachd a’ leughadh Kierkegaard an diugh na tha a’ leughadh Hegel.
We know from Einstein that we must do that [ie. study the philosopher himself] and that is why more [people] read Kierkegaard today than read Hegel. td. 103
Bha mi ’g òl barrachd o bhàsaich mo bhean cóig bliadhna air ais.
I had been drinking more since my wife had died five years previously. td. 6
“Mas e sin a tha sibh ag iarraidh, cosgaidh e barrachd,” ars esan.
“If that’s what you want, it’ll cost more,” he said. td. 100
“Ist! Dhèanainn fada bharrachd airson mac d’ athar nam b’ urrainn dhomh!” arsa Aonghas.
“Wheesht! I would do much more for your father’s son if I could!” said Angus. td. 51

With a genitive modifier –
Dh’òl Raonaid barrachd uisge. Rachel drank more water.
Tha barrachd chon aig Màiri. Mary has more dogs.
[...] ’Se glé bheag de chobhair a thug a’ Phàrlamaid a riamh do ’n Ghàidhlig no do fhoghlum agus do litreachas na Gàidhlig. [...] Dé na rudan a dh’ fhaodadh sinn iarraidh? Tuilleadh de luchd-teagaisg ’s de luchd-ceasnachaidh Gàidhlig. Airgead gu leabhraichean uallachadh is a chlo-bhualadh. Barrachd tìde air an réidio agus air telebhisean. [...] Barrachd rannsachaidh air caitheamh-beatha nan Gaidheal, an cànan, an eachdraidh, an ceòl, is mar sin air adhart.
[...] The Parliament has given very little assistance ever to the Gaelic language or to Gaelic education and literature. [...] What are the things that we could demand? More Gaelic teachers and inspectors. Money to prepare and print books. More time on the radio and on television. [...] More research on the lifestyle of the Gaels, their language, their history, their music, and so on. td. 9, ‘Air an Spiris’
Dh’fhàg mi i a’ smaoineachadh gur dòcha gu robh barrachd fìrinn anns a’ phàipear-naidheachd na bha an Caiptean deònach aideachadh.
I left her thinking that it was possible that there was more truth in the newspaper than the Captain was willing to admit. td. 39
Cha do mhair an cosnadh fada nuair a chaidh an luchd-obrach air stailc son barrachd tuarastail.
The employment had not been going on for long when the workers went on strike for more pay. td. 185
Bha iad ag iarraidh barrachd chumhachdan an aghaidh stailcean, agus lagh an airm a chur an gnìomh ann an àiteachan.
They were wanting more powers against strikes, and to enforce martial law in places. td. 32
Nan robh barrachd de chothrom aca air cluich roimh-làimh, cha b’e an dara duais a bhitheadh aca.
If they had had more opportunity to practise beforehand, it would not have been the second prize that they won. td. 84 Note the use of the preposition de here, rather than a simple genitive.

The preposition de with a definite noun –
Dh’òl Raonaid barrachd den fhìon. Rachel drank more of the wine.
Cheannaich Màiri barrachd de mo bhriosgaidean. Mary bought more of my biscuits.
Aig an ám sin bha an Dotair Lachlann Grannd am Bail’-a’-chaolais trang a’ toirt a bheachdan fhéin air suidheachadh na Gàidhealtachd agus na ceumannan a bu chòir a ghabhail a chum is gum faigheadh barrachd de na Gàidheil cothrom a b’ fheàrr air beòshlaint iomchuidh a chosnadh ’nan tìr féin, gun éiginn orra siubhal gu tìrean céine air cheann an fhortain.
At that time Doctor Lachlan Grant was in Ballahullish busy giving his own opinions on the state of the Highlands and the steps that should be taken so that more of the Gaels get a better chance to earn a good living in their own land, without needing to travel to foreign lands to make their fortune. td. 9
Bha sinn ag iomairt nan cairt agus dòcha gun d’òl mi barrachd den leann na bha còir agam.
We were playing cards and perhaps I had drunk more of the beer than I should have. td. 162

With a prepositional pronoun –
Dh’òl Raonaid barrachd dheth. Rachel drank more of it.
Tha barrachd dhiubh aig Màiri. Mary has more of them.
Chuir mi dh’ iarraidh sguad nan gunnaichean an uair sin, ach rinn mi mearachd. Bha barrachd dhiùbh-san ann na bha dùil agam.
I sent for the gun squad then, but I made a mistake. There was more of them then I had expected. td. 71
... agus barrachd aca ag obair air na bàtaichean iasgaich ...
and more of them working on the fishing boats td. 62 Note the use of aca at them rather than dhiubh of them here.

barrachd mu more [information/knowledge] about –
Tha Màiri ag iarraidh barrachd a chluinntinn mu choin Mary wants to hear more about dogs
Co-dhiù, bha bràthair Syd na oifigear ann am prìosan Ghlaschu agus lorg esan barrachd mu dheidhinn Heyford.
Anyway, Syd’s brother was an officer in Glasgow prison and he found out more about Heyford. td. 60
Ann an Cruinn’-eòlas bha sinn a’ cluinntinn barrachd mu dhùthchannan coimheach na bha sinn mu ar stairsnich fhèin..
In Geography we heard more about exotic countries than we did about our own threshold. td. 139

One (possibly conservative) way of expressing the target of comparison is to use agus (usually contracted to is or ’s) followed by the relative particle a eg.
Tha barrachd chon aig Dòmhnall ’s a tha aig Màiri, Donald has more dogs than Mary [does].
Tha barrachd chon aig Dòmhnall ’s a tha cait aige. Donald has more dogs than [he does] cats.
Dh’òl Raonaid barrachd bùrn ’s a dh’òl Seumas. Rachel drank more water than James [did].
Dh’òl Raonaid barrachd bùrn ’s a dh’òl i fìon. Rachel drank more wine than [she did] wine.
Seachd àraidh an déidh dhomh barrachd ’s a choisinn e fhéin fad a’ gheamhraidh air a’ bheairt a chosg air tagsaidhean!
Especially after I had spent more on taxis than he himself had earned all winter long on the loom! td. 21
Feumaidh mi aideachadh gu bheil iadsan a’ faicinn barrachd toinisg anns na New Mathematics ’s a tha mise.
I have to admit that they [the children] see more sense in the New Mathematics than I do. td. 64

An alternative is to use the preposition air followed by the relative particle na eg.
Tha barrachd chon aig Dòmhnall air na tha aig Màiri. Donald has more dogs than Mary [does].
Dh’òl Raonaid barrachd fìona air na dh’òl Seumas. Rachel drank more wine than James [did].
Ach tha fios a’m a-nise gur tric a tha an dìoghaltas a’ cosg barrachd air na ’s fhiach e.
But I know now that revenge often costs more than it’s worth. td. 64
A bheil sinn a’ pàidheadh a mach barrachd air na tha sinn a’ toirt a stigh?
Are we paying out more than we are taking in? td. 71

However usage varies considerably here, with a range of modern vernacular contracted forms perhaps influenced by English.
Chuala mi Eachann Posta a’ gearan an là-roimhe gu bheil an tigh-sgoile agus am mansa a’ toirt barrachd oibre dha na a’ chuid eile de’n choimhearsnachd uile gu léir.
I had heard Hector the Postman complaining the day before that the schoolhouse and the manse brought him more work than the rest of the community altogether. td. 67
Tha fhios againn bho Einstein gu feum sinn sin a dhèanamh agus ’se sin as coireach gu bheil barrachd a’ leughadh Kierkegaard an diugh na tha a’ leughadh Hegel.
We know from Einstein that we must do that [ie. study the philosopher himself] and that is why more [people] read Kierkegaard today than read Hegel. td. 103
Dh’fhàg mi i a’ smaoineachadh gur dòcha gu robh barrachd fìrinn anns a’ phàipear-naidheachd na bha an Caiptean deònach aideachadh.
I left thinking that it was possible that there was more truth in the newspaper than the Captain was willing to admit. td. 39
Dh’atharraich a bheatha barrachd na bha dùil aige a’ mhadainn a chaidh e shireadh obrach anns a’ chompanaidh seo.
His life had changed more than he had been expecting the morning he had gone looking for work in this company. td. 26
[Tha an luchd-èisteachd] a’ cur barrachd earbsa anns na naidheachdan Gàidhlig na anns na naidheachdan Beurla.
The listeners put more trust in the Gaelic news than in the English news. td. 237

When the target of the comparison is a numeric quantity, it is usually introduced by the preposition air, meaning than in this context –
Tha barrachd air fichead cù aig Màiri. Mary has more than twenty dogs.
Bha Eirisgeidh ceangailte ris a’ pharraiste sin an uair sin, agus bha barrachd air dà mhile dhaoine [sic.] ’sa’ pharraiste uile gu léir.
Eriskay was attached to that parish at that time, and there were more than two thousand people in the parish as a whole. td. 52
Chuimhnich e gun do bhuail droch throm-laighe e barrachd air aon uair ’na bheatha.
He recalled that bad nightmares had affected him more than once in his life. td. 39
Bha iad ag iarraidh deich tasdain fhichead air an luchd, ach cha robh am fear [...] deònach air barrachd air cóig ar fhichead a thoirt air.
They were wanting thirty shillings for the load, but the man [...] was not willing to give more than twenty-five for it. td. 70

But note usages like barrachd agus (fichead) as well.
“Tha mi ’n dòchas gum bi barrachd is uair a thìde no dhà againn còmhla ri chèile an turas seo!”
“I hope we’ll have more than an hour or two together this time!” td. 73

barrachd air can also be used to mean ‘something in addition to’, ‘not only’ –
Tha barrachd air coin aig Màiri. Tha cait aice cuideachd. Mary has more than just dogs. She has cats too.
Tha mi cinnteach nach do ghabh mi ach dà ghlainne uisge-beatha, ach feumaidh gu robh barrachd air uisge-beatha annta.
I’m sure that I only had two glasses of whisky, but there must have been more than just [ie. something in addition to] whisky in them. td. 48
“O Coinneach Iain,” arsa Dougie. “Rinn e sin. ’S math dh’fhaodte gum bu chòir do bharrachd air-san sin a dhèanamh.”
“Oh Kenneth John,” said Dougie. “He did that [left the village]. Perhaps more than just him should have done that.” td. 51
Tha An Comunn Gaidhealach a’ bruidhinn air Seanaileir ùr a thaghadh a bhios os cionn obair a’ Chomuinn. [...] Bhiodh a leòr aige ri dhèanamh an toiseach ag ath-nuadhachadh dreach a’ Chomuinn. [...] Ach dh’ fheumadh am Fear-stiùiridh ùr barrachd air a sin a dhèanamh. Dh’ fheumadh e siubhal a dhèanamh eadar Rubha Robhanais agus Ceann Bharraidh, eadar am Parbh is Maol Chinn-tìre, agus cha deanadh math dha dìochuimhneachadh gu robh obair a’ Chomuinn a’ buntainn ri Coimisean nan Croitearan an Inbhirnis, ri Roinn an Fhoghluim an Dùn-Eideann, agus ri Tigh nan Cumantan an Lunnainn. An duine a theid do gach àite dhiubh sin, agus a bheir barrachd air còmhradh leis dhachaidh, nì e feum do ’n Chomunn is do ’n Ghàidhlig.
The Highland Society is talking about choosing a new General who will oversee the Society’s work. [...] He would have enough to do initially reforming the Society. [...] But the new leader would have to do more than (just) that. He would have to travel between the Butt of Lewis and Barra Head, between Cape Wrath and the Mull of Kintyre, and he should not forget that the Society’s work is related to the Crofters’ Commission in Inverness, to the Education Department in Edinburgh, and to the House of Commons in London. The person who goes to each of those places, and who brings home more than (just) conversation, will benefit the Society and the Gaelic language. td. 105, ‘Air an Spiris’

barrachd can be emphasised with the adjective fada.
“Ist! Dhèanainn fada bharrachd airson mac d’ athar nam b’ urrainn dhomh!” arsa Aonghas.
“Wheesht! I would do far more for your father’s son if I could!” said Angus. td. 51

barrachd agus barrachd more and more –
Ann an Dùn Èideann anns na naochadan bha barrachd agus barrachd inbhich airson Gàidhlig ionnsachadh.
In Edinburgh in the 90s there were more and more adults wanting to learn Gaelic. td. 85 barrachd agus barrachd inbheach ?
